title: maia-hdl: update README
body: Update README to reflect that there are now Python packages published to PyPI.

title: ci: update checkout actions to v4
body: The v3 action uses a deprecated NodeJS version.

title: Add IQEngine
body:
This PR adds to maia-httpd and maia-wasm the changes required to add IQEngine as a viewer for the IQ recording stored on the Pluto DDR.

The way in which this works is by implementing some of the IQEngine backend API methods in maia-httpd. The IQEngine client is compressed using lz4 to save ramfs space and served by maia-httpd. When the IQEngine client is fetched by the web browser, it starts talking to maia-httpd believing that it is a regular IQEngine backend. The IQEngine API methods in maia-httpd return IQ samples / metadata corresponding to the recording done to the DDR by Maia SDR.

Previously each request to get IQ data from the recording involved `mmap()`ing the recording and performing cache invalidation of the whole recording. This is not a good approach for IQEngine, because it performs many separate queries to get pieces of IQ data, and invalidating the cache is time consuming. `mmap()`ing a large file is also time consuming, since it involves creating page tables. Instead, a shared "global" `mmap()` is held by the application, and this is used to serve all the queries. When a new recording is done, the old `mmap()` is unmapped and a new `mmap()` is done. This invalidates the cache. The "global" `mmap()` is managed with a `RwLock`, which prevents getting IQ data while a recording is in progress or starting a recording while IQ data is being retrieved.

title: Some fixes for the build system
body: This fixes the `plutosdr-fw.yml` workflow by updating it to Vivado 2022.2 and removes the custom `Cross.toml` for maia-httpd.

title: maia-httpd: bump axum to v0.7
body: This requires a few code changes due a major version change in axum.

title: maia-httpd: regenerate maia-pac with svd2rust v0.31
body: Code generated with svd2rust v0.31 includes some API changes that require changes in maia-httpd. Registers are now accessed using methods instead of struct fields.

title: update adi-hdl submodule to version used in plutosdr-fw v0.38
maia-wasm: fix clippy lints
maia-wasm: cull waterfall frequencies outside passband
body:
This eliminates from the list of frequency ticks the frequencies which fall outside the passband, reducing the number of elements in the VAOs used for the frequency axis. This change was marked as a TODO, because it is a good optimization. However, it has been implemented specifically to address #79.

In that issue we have found that for large horizontal resolutions (above 2800 px approx.), the waterfall would panic because the number of generated frequencies is too large (the VAOs are indexed by uint16, so this sets a limitation). This change improves the situation, allowing horizontal resolutions of up to approx 5600 px (the exact value depends on the sample rate).

Larger resolutions would still crash, but solving this would require a different strategy. In addition, with very large resolutions maybe it is not reasonable to use the same size for the frequency labels (it is specified in pixels of text height). If the size of the text in pixels is proportional to the resolution, then there would be no problem. The only reason why there is a problem is that now the text size in px is fixed, so larger horizontal resolutions are able to squeeze together more frequency labels for a given zoom factor.

Solves #79.

title: maia-httpd: fix sigmf version format
body: According to https://github.com/sigmf/SigMF/pull/298 the SigMF version should not have a leading `v`.

title: maia-httpd,maia-wasm: optimize code generation
body: Use codegen-units=1 in maia-httpd and maia-wasm. Use CPU flags for the Zynq Cortex A9 in maia-httpd.

title: Release v0.6.0
body: This contains the Cargo.lock and changelog updates for the release.

title: Add spectrometer peak detect mode
body:
This adds a peak detect mode to the spectrometer as described in #10. A new power average / peak detect implementation using one DSP48 at 3x clock instead of two DSP48 at 1x clock has been added to maia-hdl. The average / peak detect mode is exposed in on register. The required changes to support setting this parameter have been added to maia-json, maia-httpd and maia-wasm.

Here is a demo of how the peak detect mode and the UI element looks like. This is the 1090 MHz aeronautical band, where there is ADS-B and DME signals, which are all pulsed. The spectrometer is first running on average mode (top part), and then is changed to peak detect.

![peak_detect_screenshot](https://github.com/maia-sdr/maia-sdr/assets/15093841/3901297b-b282-47b2-9305-10ccde1e51ed)

Note that the DME and ADS-B signals are much more visible in peak detect mode. There is also another change, which is that the noise floor is higher. Normalization to make changes between average and peak detect look well is tricky. Currently, the normalization is that average corresponds to average power within each integration, and peak corresponds to maximum power within each integration. A signal that has constant envelope will be displayed with the same power (and same colour in the waterfall) in both modes. However, noise, and many other kinds of signals get high measurements for peak than for average.

(This closes #10)

title: maia-wasm: fix large number of frequency ticks and labels
body:
The number of frequencies that was generated for the ticks and labels in the waterfall was too large (above 2^16). Since we use a u16 element array buffer, we were not drawing most of the generated frequencies due to overflows when converting to u16.

This bug was noticed because at 45 Msps the ticks wouldn't draw at all.

This decreases the depth of step levels to a more reasonable value, which seems to guarantee that we don't generate more than 2^16 vertices for the ticks nor for the labels. Asserts have been added to check that this is indeed the case.

The sample rate at which we get more frequencies seems to be 20.7 Msps, where we get 25555 frequencies. At 20.8 Msps we get 9111 frequencies. These two are perhaps the extreme cases of this frequency gridding algorithm.

This fixes #73.

title: Fix SigMF core:datetime formatting and release
body: This introduces a commit to fix the SigMF `core:datetime` formatting in maia-httpd, updates the dependencies of all the Rust crates, and bumps a new release version.

title: ci: build plutosdr-fw without XSA file
body: This uses Vivado to build the bitstream and FSBL instead of using the bitstream in a pre-built XSA file.

title: ci: replace plutosdr-fw runner by self-hosted
body: This is the first test to get building the PlutoSDR firmware with Vivado running on a self-hosted runner.

title: v0.5.0 release: fix timing in v0.4.0
body: This makes a change in the `ClkNxCommonEdge` module to improve timing, since release v0.4.0 was not closing timing when building the Pluto bitstream.

title: v0.4.0 release
body: This adds support for the Pluto+ in a new stable release.

title: Add support for Pluto+
body:
This is a draft PR to add support for the Pluto+.

Currently the Vivado project is done, but the remaining elements of the firmware need to be added in a good way to avoid code duplication. The differences between the Pluto+ and the ADALM Pluto can be found in https://github.com/plutoplus/plutoplus/tree/master/patches

title: bump to v0.3.1
body: Also bump the version of maia-hdl to v0.1.2.

title: maia-hdl: fix spectrum integrator reset value
body:
A warning was being given because the counter for the spectrum integrator had a negative reset value (while it is unsigned). To fix this, we take modulo to make the reset value positive.

This fixes #27.

title: Update Rust dependencies
body: Update dependencies of `maia-httpd` and `maia-wasm` and bump the versions of these crates.

title: ci:plutosdr-fw: remove pre-release creation
body:
The pre-release creation process has been too flaky. This removes it.

As a workaround, instructions to download the artifact are added to the README.

title: ci:plutosdr-fw: fix action-gh-release commit
body: The commit of the action-gh-release has changed, since the previous one was not built correctly.

title: ci:plutosdr-fw: try to force release to not draft
body: Use a modified action that forces release draft to false.

title: ci:plutosdr-fw: do not delete previous pre-release
body: Try to delete only the pre-release tag to avoid the new pre-released being in a draft state after the action finishes.

title: ci:plutosdr-fw: fix latest XSA discovery
body: Now that we have tags such as maia-json-..., we need to change the way that the latests maia-sdr tag is found.

title: New releases of Rust crates
body: Prepares releases of Rust crates.

title: ci: some updates
body: Splits the pluto-fw workflow into two jobs to avoid rebuilding the firmware if the release creation fails, and adds actions to publish the Rust crates to crates.io on tag pushes.

title: ci: remove stray 'if:' in plutosdr-fw-pr-comment
body: The correct 'if:' is applied to the job globally, so we don't need this 'if:' in the step anymore.

title: ci: use get-workflow-origin in pluto-sdr-fw-pr-comment
body:
Try to get the PR number using the get-workflow-origin action.

Using the github context to get the PR number in a workflow_run triggered workflow is unreliable, as documented in https://github.com/orgs/community/discussions/25220 We use the workaround mentioned in
https://github.com/orgs/community/discussions/25220#discussioncomment-3246923

title: ci: try to fix plutosdr-fw-pr-comment
body: This is giving a syntax error, so we try in another way to dump the context.

title: ci: fix debug statement in plutosdr-fw-pr-comment
body: Move the 'if' to the step that adds the comment. Otherwise the debug will never print if the step is skipped.

title: ci: add debug to plutosdr-fw-pr-comment workflow
body: This adds a debug print to the workflow, since it is being skipped when it shouldn't.

title: Add Inferno colormap
body:
This PR provides support for the Inferno colormap. It was implemented by comparative method with respect to existing colormaps  and from the existing Matplotlib's LUT (https://github.com/matplotlib/matplotlib/blob/main/lib/matplotlib/_cm_listed.py).

**Please note:** the code builds but I didn't have any PlutoSDR at hand now to test it. While the code is fairly simple and adds no new logic to the software, I still miss some testing on it. Feel free to take this PR as a WIP if the colormap does not look right.

title: add note about plutosdr-fw action to README
ci:pluto: ignore prerelease tags when fetching XSA
body: The plutosdr-fw-prerelease tag doesn't have an XSA asset, so the action is currently failing in this step.

title: ci:pluto: try to fix delete-tag-and-release
body: Pass github token in the env instead of as a with argument.

title: ci:plutosdr-fw: delete existing pre-release before creating a new one
body: Otherwise the release tag an text are not updated.

title: ci: try to fix plutosdr-fw-pr-comment
body: Another attempt at fixing the action, after trying some things in a personal fork.

title: ci: try to fix plutosdr-fw-pr-comment
body: Put issue-number field first, just in case.

body: There was a stray dependency in the job, which made the workflow malformed.

title: ci: fix plutosdr-fw PR comment in PRs from forks
body: The current approach doesn't work because we can't make comments from a pull_request triggered PR. We use another workflow that triggers when the main workflow has completed.

title: maia-httpd: skip f32 conversion when no receivers
body:
Avoid a conversion from u64 to f32 when no clients are listening to spectrometer, as this conversion consumes ~50% of CPU cycles in idle mode.

This closes #29.

title: ci: build plutosdr-fw
body:
This adds a Github workflow that builds the Pluto SDR firmware by using the XSA in the maia-sdr release corresponding to latest tag preceding the commit. The firmware image is uploaded as artifact.

The workflow runs on pull requests and pushes to main.

title: bump to v0.2.1
body: Bumps maia-hdl to v0.1.1 due to the update of adi-hdl to the Vivado 2021.2 branch.

title: maia-httpd: build against buildroot toolchain with cross
body: This uses a custom Docker image (taken from the maia-sdr-docker repository) to build against the buildroot uclibc toolchain using cross.

title: ci: move maia-sdr-devel from docker hub to ghcr.io

title: adi-hdl: update to commit used in plutosdr-fw v0.36
body:
This bumps the adi-hdl submodule to the commit hash used in plutosdr-fw v0.36 and v0.37. There is no tag associated with this hash, but the branch is hdl_2021_R2. The corresponding version of Vivado is 2021.2

The path of the adi_env.tcl script has changed, so the maia-hdl pluto system_project.tcl has been updated accordingly.

title: Recording enhancements
body:
This PR addresses the suggestions in #3.

Two features are added.

# Prepend timestamp to recording filename

This adds an option to prepend the date and time to the IQ recording filename.
    
A prepend_timestamp boolean field in the REST API controls whether prepending mode is active. In prepending mode, when a recording is started, the current filename is examined. If the beginning of the filename is formatted as a  timestamp, this timestamp is stripped. In other case, the filename is left as is. Next, the timestamp corresponding to the recording start (the same which is used for the SigMF metadata) is formatted as %Y-%m-%d-%H-%M-%S_ and prepended to the filename.

# Recording maximum duration

This adds a maximum duration field to the recorder REST API, which specifies the maximum duration for the next recording in seconds. A maximum duration of 0 indicates unlimited maximum duration (only limited by the RAM buffer size).
    
If the maximum duration is set to a value t > 0, the recording will be automatically stopped by maia-httpd after t + 0.1 seconds. The extra 0.1 seconds is added just in case the CPU timer is faster than the ADC sampling clock, or not very accurate, so that there is always the guarantee that at least the required number of samples have been recorded to RAM.
    
When the SigMF file is assembled for download, the SigMF file will be formed with exactly the number of samples corresponding to the maximum duration (this feature can even be used after the recording has been done, to "cut short" a longer recording).

----

The recording properties dialog now looks like this:

![ui_example](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/15093841/227644702-785ba482-110a-4d7f-91cb-1f928eefd9eb.png)

----

Here is a `pluto.frm` firmware image in case anyone wants to try these changes:
[pluto.frm.zip](https://github.com/maia-sdr/maia-sdr/files/11066713/pluto.frm.zip)

@devnulling @jacobagilbert any feedback is more than welcome.

title: maia-wasm: disable RX gain input field in AGC modes
body:
If the RX AGC is not set to Manual mode, disable the RX gain input field, since it is intended as read-only.

There is no visual change in how the web browser represents the disabled field, but it is not possible to click it and enter a value.

This closes #14.

title: bump to v0.2.0
body: Update the CHANGELOGs of the components, as well as the Cargo.lock's

title: add CHANGELOGs and bump some versions
body: Bump maia-httpd to v0.1.1 because of minor changes and maia-wasm to v0.2.0 because of API-breaking changes.

title: maia-wasm: fix clippy lints
body: Fix clippy lints that have appeared in rust 1.68.

title: maia-wasm: fix frequency change by waterfall scroll
body:
60db8ffcfd704e37346911bca543e7a22eb34c32 broke the RX LO frequency change by scrolling the waterfall. The reason for this is that by the time that the onpointermove callback was created in WaterfallInteraction, self.ui had not yet been set, so the callback would always see this as None, even if we would update it later on.

The type of WaterfallInteraction::ui is now changed to an Rc<RefCell<>>, so that the callback "sees" the change that happens later on, when WaterfallInteraction::set_ui is called.

title: maia-httpd: do not use chrono default features
body:
This eliminates a dependency on time >= 0.1, < 0.2, which has a security problem, as reported by dependabot.
(See https://github.com/maia-sdr/maia-sdr/security/dependabot/1).

title: maia-wasm: let waterfall grow to occupy empty viewport space
body:
This removes the blank space that can appear below the UI form when the viewport is wide, by letting the waterfall grow to occupy the remaining space.

A flexbox containing the waterfall canvas and the UI form is added. This flexbox is used to control the waterfall size, which has a minimum of 75vh (this has been reduced from 80vh) but can grow to fill the remainig space of the flexbox minimum height, which is 100vh.

The UI form can cause the flexbox to overflow if the screen is narrow enough that the form doesn't fit in 25vh.

---

This is how the new layout looks like on my 1920x1080 PC screen (opening the image in a new tab is recommended, since with a white background it is difficult to tell where the screenshot ends).

![maia-fullscreen](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/15093841/223843898-f5d603f7-4aed-4a8c-8587-5a99824ce8c8.jpg)

This is Firefox emulating a Galaxy S20+ Android 11 Chrome 87 in portrait and landscape.

![maia-s20p_portrait](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/15093841/223844469-b3b463e6-14d1-4812-af65-87588f631232.jpg)

![maia-s20p_landscape](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/15093841/223844481-0e1b2ddc-955b-4882-9350-148c2cc42e88.jpg)

title: maia-wasm: add example of standalone waterfall
body: Inspired by the [experiment](https://github.com/bastibl/maia-sdr/commit/ec0a2ca873232ae080a70059dc85434219814443) done by @bastibl about using the WebGL2 waterfall in FutureSDR, I have refactored part of the maia-wasm `lib.rs` to improve the reusability of the waterfall and added a crate with an example that shows how to use the waterfall in a standalone way. This example reads the waterfall data from a JPEG file embedded in the wasm file. The example will also be showed as a demo in the Maia SDR webpage.

title: maia-wasm: fix uncaught PATCH errors and gain change errors
body:
This addresses the problems spotted in #2, by the following changes:

* Instead of causing an uncaught error in a promise when a PATCH request fails with an error 500, we log the error to the console and terminate the promise normally.
* We do not attempt to change the RX gain unless the AGC mode is "manual".

title: maia-json: omit null fields in JSON PATCH requests
body:
Use the serde attribute
```
  #[serde(skip_serializing_if = "Option::is_none")]
```
to omit from the JSON sent in a PATCH request those fields whose value is None.

title: maia-httpd: fix URL typo in README
